_header: Of all the marvel of Merlin how he makes his moan
_description: A late Merlin prophecy — alliterative lines in various stanzas, quatrains abab, 8-line stanzas, six-line stanzas. nine-line stanzas

BodRawC813.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 214.

BLAdd24663.First Lines: Above all places Merlyn makethe his moneTake heede to his talkinge wher he tellethe…
BLAdd24663.Last Lines: …When the childe beattethe the mother then the father will take vengeanceThre ffloodes fflowinge in Bryttayne shall cawse greatt connfvsion
BLAdd24663.Note:
See Weiskott (2020)
XWeiskott,  Eric. 
             Meter and Modernity in English Verse, 1350–1650.
            
         Philadelphia: University of Pennsylvania Press, 2020.: 214 for second entry (first and last line not recorded).
BLAdd24663.Editions:
Weiskott,  Eric. 
             “A New Text of the  Marvels of Merlin.” 
             Journal of the Early Book Society
         19 (2016): 227-39: 230-2.

BLHar2382.First Lines:
Of al þe merveilis of Merlyn how he made his monetake tent to
                    his talkyng in tales þer he tellys…
BLHar2382.Last Lines:
…When þe child smytes þe moder þe fader shal hym
                    lestreyethe flodes flowyng in hitayne shal cause interdiction
BLHar2382.Note:
‘Explicit’ written below and to right of last line,
                    by scribe (f. 128).
BLHar2382.Attributed Title:
prophecia Merlenis (f. 127v, in upper margin as RT by
                    scribe)
